conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway: walls have visible height/thickness, floors read as a separate plane, multiple wall faces are visible, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose interior spaces.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D massing with clean cutaway and readable interior volume; only minor simplification at some wall junction details.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall layout and adjacencies largely match (central living/dining, surrounding bedrooms, kitchen/utility zone), but several proportions/wall runs appear slightly adjusted and openings (doors/windows) are not consistently or clearly replicated.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture blocks (beds, sofa seating, dining) and kitchen counters are present and placed in plausible rooms; bathroom fixtures are simplified/less consistently represented.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clear with good visibility; however, room text labels are present in the 3D render and reduce presentation cleanliness per rubric.

detected_errors.description: Noticeable proportional drift in some room sizes/wall lengths compared with the 2D plan (layout is recognizable but not fully dimension-faithful).
Doors/windows/openings are simplified and not all appear clearly placed/sized/oriented to match the 2D plan.
Bathroom fixtures and some interior elements are reduced/simplified, lowering room identity certainty in service spaces.
Text labels are embedded in the 3D render, reducing presentation/background score per rubric.

summary: A clearly valid 3D cutaway conversion with strong spatial readability and mostly faithful layout, but with moderate proportional drift and simplified/mismatched openings.
